title: Thoma Bravo Merges ForgeRock with Ping Identity
description:
The private equity firm merges the newly acquired ForgeRock with Ping Identity, combining two of the biggest names in enterprise IAM market.

The post Thoma Bravo Merges ForgeRock with Ping Identity appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: FBI Finds 1,580 Bitcoin in Crypto Wallets Linked to North Korean Hackers
description:
The FBI has published information on six crypto wallets in which North Korean hackers moved roughly 1,580 Bitcoin from various heists.

The post FBI Finds 1,580 Bitcoin in Crypto Wallets Linked to North Korean Hackers  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Smart Cities: Utopian Dream, Security Nightmare, or Political Gimmick?
description:
As smart cities evolve with more and more integrated connected services, cybersecurity concerns will increase dramatically.

The post Smart Cities: Utopian Dream, Security Nightmare, or Political Gimmick? appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cybersecurity Companies Report Surge in Ransomware Attacks
description:
Cybersecurity companies have released a dozen ransomware reports in recent weeks and most of them show a surge in attacks.

The post Cybersecurity Companies Report Surge in Ransomware Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: 3,000 Openfire Servers Exposed to Attacks Targeting Recent Vulnerability
description:
More than 3,000 Openfire servers are not patched against a recent vulnerability and are exposed to attacks employing a new exploit.

The post 3,000 Openfire Servers Exposed to Attacks Targeting Recent Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: The End of “Groundhog Day” for the Security in the Boardroom Discussion?
description:
As the SEC cyber incident disclosure rules come into effect, organizations will be forced to seriously consider giving security leaders a seat at the table.

The post The End of “Groundhog Day” for the Security in the Boardroom Discussion? appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: First Weekly Chrome Security Update Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities
description:
Google has released the first weekly Chrome security update, which patches five memory safety vulnerabilities, including four rated ‘high severity’.

The post First Weekly Chrome Security Update Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: US Government Publishes Guidance on Migrating to Post-Quantum Cryptography
description:
CISA, NSA, and NIST urge organizations to create quantum-readiness roadmaps and prepare for post-quantum cryptography migration.

The post US Government Publishes Guidance on Migrating to Post-Quantum Cryptography appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Exploitation of Ivanti Sentry Zero-Day Confirmed
description:
While initially it was unclear if the Ivanti Sentry vulnerability CVE-2023-38035 has been exploited, the vendor and CISA have now confirmed it.

The post Exploitation of Ivanti Sentry Zero-Day Confirmed appeared first on SecurityWeek.
